intro: Dimorphanthera macleaniifolia, commonly known as the Maclean's flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange-red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in coastal and inland regions of Queensland. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and public spaces for its vibrant floral display.
